relevant_findings.general: Pleasant, alert, in no acute distress
relevant_findings.HEENT: EOMI, no scleral icterus, mucus membranes moist
relevant_findings.pulmonary: Clear to auscultation b/l, No W/R/R
relevant_findings.abdominal: Soft, tender to palpation at right lower quadrant. Positive Rovsing's sign. Nondistended. No palpable masses. Normoactive bowel sounds.
relevant_findings.extremities: Warm and well perfused, no edema

relevant_findings.lower_chest: A 2-3 mm nodule is seen in the right lung base. No evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.
relevant_findings.hepatobiliary: A couple subcentimeter hypodensities in the right hepatic lobe, likely hepatic cysts or biliary hamartomas.
relevant_findings.pancreas: Abnormal dilatation of the main pancreatic duct, measuring up to 5 mm. No peripancreatic stranding.
relevant_findings.spleen: A small subcentimeter hypodensity in the spleen, possibly a small hemangioma.
relevant_findings.urinary: Multiple cortically based hypodense lesions in bilateral kidneys, measuring up to 1.3 cm, compatible with simple cysts.
relevant_findings.gastrointestinal: Appendix enlarged, measuring up to 2.0 cm, with adjacent fat stranding and a tiny pocket of rim enhancing fluid adjacent to the tip.
relevant_findings.pelvis: Urinary bladder and distal ureters unremarkable. No free fluid in the pelvis.
relevant_findings.vascular: No abdominal aortic aneurysm. Mild atherosclerotic disease noted.
relevant_findings.bones: No evidence of worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture.
relevant_findings.soft_tissues: A tiny fat containing umbilical hernia. Otherwise, the abdominal and pelvic wall normal.
